content.text:
I'm ready to help you explore the codebase and design implementation plans. I understand that I'm in READ-ONLY mode and cannot create, modify, or delete any files.

Let me get familiar with the project structure first:

<function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && find . -type f -name "*.go" -o -name "*.ts" -o -name "*.tsx" | head -30</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && cat README.md 2>/dev/null || echo "No README found"</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && ls -la</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>
<invoke name="bash">
<parameter name="command">cd /Users/patrick/workingdir/personal-agent && cat package.json 2>/dev/null | head -50</parameter>
</invoke>
</function_calls>

I'm now warmed up and ready to help with your planning tasks. This appears to be a personal agent project with:

- **Go backend** (`packages/go-backend/`) - handles inference, configuration, and server logic
- **Desktop UI** (`packages/desktop/ui/`) - React/TypeScript frontend with agent dashboard, chat, and various views
- **Recent work** on provider management, UI density improvements, and skills restoration

The project uses:
- Multiple AI providers (OpenAI, and based on git status, potentially Gemini)
- WebSocket communication between frontend and backend
- Agent capabilities, skills, and tool approval workflows

I'm ready to explore specific areas and create implementation plans based on requirements you provide. What would you like me to help design?
